body.p: The following sections describe the format of the IPC messages used to communicate with flash interface.0flash_interface_messages
Format of flash address used in flash interface IPC messages is not fixed and varies with flash geometry. The following table describes the flash address format.

description.p: Based on number of pages in a flash block, number of bits allocated for page number will change.
Based on number of blocks in a flash LUN, number of bits allocated for block number will change.
Based on number of LUNs in a flash target, number of bits allocated for LUN number will change.

body.p: This message is sent to update flash channel configuration information.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.
This field encodes the request sub message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
Number of contexts per flash channel. The flash channel processor support 16 contexts allowing up to 16 flash logical units to perform read/program/erase operations in parallel.
LUN bit position in flash address.
Flash page size including the spares in DWords
First context number in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the first context
First Context LUN number within first context CE
Second Context number in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the second context
Second Context LUN number within second context CE
Third Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the third context
Third Context LUN number within third context CE
Fourth Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the first context
Fourth Context LUN number within fourth context CE
Fifth Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the first context
Fifth Context LUN number within fifth context CE
Sixth Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the sixth context
Sixth Context LUN number within sixth context CE
Seventh Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the seventh context
Seventh Context LUN number within seventh context CE
Eighth Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the eighth context
Eighth Context LUN number within eighth context CE
Ninth Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the ninth context
Ninth Context LUN number within ninth context CE
Tenth Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the tenth context
Tenth Context LUN number within tenth context CE
Eleventh Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the eleventh context
Eleventh Context LUN number within eleventh context CE
Twelfth Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the twelfth context
Twelfth Context LUN number within twelfth context CE
Thirteenth Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the thirteenth context
Thirteenth Context LUN number within thirteenth context CE
Fourteenth Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the fourteenth context
Fourteenth Context LUN number within fourteenth context CE
Fifteenth Context in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the fifteenth context
Fifteenth Context LUN number within fifteenth context CE
Sixteenth Context number in flash channel controller.
Chip enable mapped to the sixteenth context
Sixteenth Context LUN number within sixteenth context CE

body.p: This message is sent to update flash ECC context information such as ECC chunk size and protected data size. This message will be repeated until ECC context data is provided for all ECC contexts.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.
This field encodes the request sub message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
Number of ECC Context Data entries.
This field indicates number of ECC context data entries are valid.
This field contain ECC context data such as context number, protected data size, and ECC chunk size.

body.p: Format of ECC context data used in FlashECCContextInfoUpdate message.

description.p: This field contains ECC chunk size in DWords for given ECC context number
This field contains protected data size in DWords for given ECC context number.

body.p: This message is sent to update flash timing parameters.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.
This field encodes the request sub message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
This field selects the Flash Timing (FT) register used for the Flash operations.

ul.li: 0 Timing mode 0 selects FT0xxx timing mode register values
1 Timing mode 1 selects FT1xxx timing mode register values

description.p: This field specifies the dummy busy time (tDBSY) in units of Flash I/O clock cycles.
Clock High to R/B Low Time
This field specifies the CLK high to R/B low (tWB) in units of Flash I/O clock cycles
This field specifies the reset time (tRST) in units of Flash I/O clock cycles
This field specifies the Power on reset time (tPOR) in units of Flash I/O clock cycles
This field specifies the busy time to change interface (tITC) in units of Flash I/O clock cycles

body.p: This message is sent to update flash power credit for different commands. The current power credits are allocated based on the maximum power required for a particular command, in future this can be broken down to smaller granular if needed based on the flash state.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.
This field encodes the request sub message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
This field specifies the Power units for the Read command, which includes the flash array read power and I/O burst read power.
This field specifies the Power units for the Program command, which includes the flash array program power and I/O burst read power.
This field specifies the Power units for the Erase command.
This specifies the maximum power used by any other commands like Read Status, Set feature, Get feature, etc

body.p: This message is sent to update flash parameters that can be changed at run time.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.
This field encodes the request sub message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
This field specifies the poll limit for the high priority message processing.
